alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 4:39AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .As Hurricane Ian moves into east central Florida early this morning, historic heavy rainfall will continue, leading to quickly rising levels on the Saint Johns River Above Lake Harney at Geneva. At this forecast point, the river has risen to Minor Flood Stage early this morning and is expected to rise further to Major Flood stage by Friday morning, potentially reaching Record Flood Stage early Sunday morning. Interests along the river should be prepared for major flood impacts. Due to wind effects and drainage from upstream, the river is forecast to remain in Major Flood into early next week. For the St. Johns River...including Above Lake Harney...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.8 feet, Water covers State Road 46 and it may become impassable near Jungle Road and Prevatt Road. Standing water on secondary roads near the river deepens to more than three feet in some areas. Flooding becomes more significant to structures and marinas from above Lake Harney to the Lake Jesup area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM EDT Thursday was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 10.9 feet Saturday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue St Johns River Above Lake Harne 8.0 8.1 Thu 3 am 9.4 10.6 10.9 10.9 10.9 &&
